item.title: David add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: David add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description: "In Watermelon Sugar the deeds were done and done again as my life is done in watermelon sugar." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: David add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "A patriot must always be ready to defend his country against his government." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: David add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Freedom begins between the ears." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: David add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: David add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The worst loneliness is to not be comfortable with yourself." -- Mark Twain

item.title: David add a quote by Barry Goldwater
item.description: "A government big enough to give you everything you want is big enough to take everything you have." -- Barry Goldwater

item.title: David add a quote by Eugene McCarthy
item.description: "Being in politics is like being a football coach. You have to be smart enough to understand the game, and dumb enough to think itâ€™s important. " -- Eugene McCarthy

item.title: David add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I am a border-ruffian from the State of Missouri. I am a Connecticut Yankee by adoption. In me, you have Missouri morals, Connecticut culture; this, gentlemen, is the combination which makes the perfect man." -- Mark Twain

item.title: David add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "In order to write about life first you must live it." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: David add a quote by Utah Phillips
item.description: "The state can't give you freedom, and the state can't take it away. You're born with it, like your eyes, like your ears. Freedom is something you assume, then you wait for someone to try to take it away. The degree to which you resist is the degree to which you are free..." -- Utah Phillips

item.title: David add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "You can best serve civilization by being against what usually passes for it." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: David add a quote by Gary Snyder
item.description: "When the mind is exhausted of images, it invents its own." -- Gary Snyder

item.title: David add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "Herb is the healing of a nation, alcohol is the destruction." -- Bob Marley

item.title: David add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Should a writer have a social purpose? Any honest writer is bound to become a critic of the society he lives in, and sometimes, like Mark Twain or Kurt Vonnegut or Leo Tolstoy or Francois Rabelais, a very harsh critic indeed. The others are sycophants, courtiers, servitors, entertainers. Shakespeare was a sychophant; however, he was and is also a very good poet, and so we continue to read him." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: David add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "The question is not if we will be extremists, but what kind of extremists we will be. The nation and the world are in dire need of creative extremists." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: David add a quote by Martin Luther King, Jr.
item.description: "Each of us is two selves. And the great burden of life is always to keep that higher self in command. Don't let the lower self take over." -- Martin Luther King, Jr.

item.title: David add a quote by Martin Luther King, Jr.
item.description: "Another way that you love your enemy is this: When the opportunity presents itself for you to defeat your enemy, that is the time which you must not do it. There will come a time, in many instances, when the person who hates you most, the person who has misused you most, the person who has gossiped about you most, the person who has spread false rumors about you most, there will come a time when you will have an opportunity to defeat that person. It might be in terms of a recommendation for a job; it might be in terms of helping that person to make some move in life. Thatâ€™s the time you must do it. That is the meaning of love. In the final analysis, love is not this sentimental something that we talk about. Itâ€™s not merely an emotional something. Love is creative, understanding goodwill for all men. It is the refusal to defeat any individual. When you rise to the level of love, of its great beauty and power, you seek only to defeat evil systems. Individuals who happen to be caught up in that system, you love, but you seek to defeat the system." -- Martin Luther King, Jr.

item.title: David add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I sincerely believe that banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies, and that the principle of spending money to be paid by posterity, under the name of funding, is but swindling futurity on a large scale." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: David add a quote by Ammon Hennacy
item.description: "Oh judge! Your damn laws! The good people don't need them, and the bad people don't obey them." -- Ammon Hennacy

item.title: David add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "The greatest purveyor of violence in the world : My own Government, I can not be Silent." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: David add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself; it's about creating yourself. So live the life you imagined." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: David add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplify, simplify." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: David add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Anarchism is not a romantic fable but the hardheaded realization, based on five thousand years of experience, that we cannot entrust the management of our lives to kings, priests, politicians, generals, and county commissioners." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: David add a quote by Utah Phillips
item.description: "Frying-Pan Jack and I were in that camp, that's where he said to me, he'd been tramping since 1927, 'I told myself in '27, if I cannot dictate the conditions of my labor, I will henceforth cease to work.' You don't have to go to college to figure these things out, no sir. He said, 'I learned when I was young that the only true life I had was the life of my brain. But if it's true that the only real life I had was the life of my brain, what sense does it make to hand that brain to someone for eight hours a day, for their particular use, on the presumption that at the end of the day they will give it back in an unmutilated condition? Fat chance!" -- Utah Phillips

item.title: David add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: David add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: David add a quote by Lysander Spooner
item.description: "Those who are capable of tyranny are capable of perjury to sustain it." -- Lysander Spooner

item.title: David add a quote by Peter Tosh
item.description: "I am not a politician... I only suffer the consequences." -- Peter Tosh

item.title: David add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "If America could be, once again, a nation of self-reliant farmers, craftsmen, hunters, ranchers, and artists, then the rich would have little power to dominate others. Neither to serve nor to rule: That was the American dream." -- Edward Abbey
